alert.note: Alert for Carter; Custer; Fallon; Powder River (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 24 at 2:14AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Montana, including the following counties, Carter, Custer, Fallon and Powder River. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, streams and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Soils are saturated in many locations due to recent heavy rainfall. The heaviest rain has ended, but additional rainfall over the next 18 hours will range from a half inch to inch in some areas. This could lead to flooding so stay alert. Precipitation will taper off tonight. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
